metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6110 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
bcron-exec in bcron before 0.10 does not close file descriptors associatedwith temporary files when running a cron job, which allows local users tomodify job files and send spam messages by accessing an open filedescriptor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6110` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bcron - 0.09-13
bcron-run - 0.09-13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bcron package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.09-13').
